title: CKD-EPI 2021 - Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate
description: CKD-EPI 2021 equation to estimate glomerular filtration rate (eGFR) based on serum creatinine, age, and sex. This 2021 version removed the race component from the original equation.

parameters.name: sex
parameters.description: Patient's biological sex, used to determine sex-specific constants in the eGFR calculation
parameters.clinical_context: Sex affects muscle mass and creatinine production. The 2021 equation uses sex-specific coefficients: κ=0.7 and α=-0.241 for females, κ=0.9 and α=-0.302 for males.

parameters.name: age
parameters.description: Patient's age in complete years, reflecting the age-related decline in kidney function
parameters.clinical_context: GFR naturally declines with age at approximately 0.75-1 mL/min/1.73m² per year after age 30. This equation is validated only for adults ≥18 years.

parameters.name: serum_creatinine
parameters.description: Standardized serum creatinine measured using IDMS-traceable methods
parameters.clinical_context: Must be standardized to IDMS (Isotope Dilution Mass Spectrometry) reference method. Non-standardized creatinine values will produce inaccurate eGFR estimates. Normal ranges: 0.6-1.2 mg/dL (females), 0.7-1.3 mg/dL (males).

ranges.interpretation: Normal or high GFR. Investigate for presence of kidney damage (proteinuria, hematuria, structural abnormalities) to determine if CKD is present. If no kidney damage, no CKD diagnosis. Continue routine health maintenance.

Mild decrease in GFR. Investigate for presence of kidney damage (proteinuria, hematuria, structural abnormalities) to determine if CKD is present. If no kidney damage and age >65, may be normal aging. Monitor annually.

ranges.description: Mild to moderate decrease in GFR
ranges.interpretation: Stage 3a Chronic Kidney Disease. Nephrology referral recommended within 6 months. Evaluate and treat complications (anemia, bone disease, acidosis). Monitor every 6 months. Blood pressure target <130/80. Consider ACE inhibitor/ARB if proteinuria present.

ranges.description: Moderate to severe decrease in GFR
ranges.interpretation: Stage 3b Chronic Kidney Disease. Urgent nephrology referral within 1-3 months. Actively manage complications (anemia, mineral bone disorder, acidosis, hyperkalemia). Monitor every 3-6 months. Optimize blood pressure control. Prepare for renal replacement therapy education.

Stage 4 Chronic Kidney Disease. Immediate nephrology referral within 2-4 weeks. Intensive management of complications. Monitor monthly to every 3 months. Begin renal replacement therapy preparation: patient education, access planning, transplant evaluation. Consider palliative care consultation if appropriate.

Stage 5 Chronic Kidney Disease (kidney failure). Immediate nephrology referral within 1-2 weeks. Kidney replacement therapy (dialysis or transplant) is necessary. Urgent dialysis access creation if not already present. Expedite transplant evaluation if candidate. Manage uremic symptoms and complications.

references: Inker LA, Eneanya ND, Coresh J, et al. New creatinine- and cystatin C-based equations to estimate GFR without race. N Engl J Med. 2021;385(19):1737-1749.
National Kidney Foundation. CKD-EPI Creatinine Equation (2021). https://www.kidney.org/ckd-epi-creatinine-equation-2021-0
notes: Equation valid only for adults (≥18 years)
Race coefficient removed in 2021 version to address health equity concerns
Less accurate at GFR >60 mL/min/1.73m² - consider confirmatory testing
Pregnancy, extremes of muscle mass, and acute kidney injury affect accuracy
Use with caution in hospitalized patients due to non-steady state conditions

indications: Screening for chronic kidney disease in adults
Drug dosing adjustments based on kidney function
contraindications: Acute kidney injury (creatinine not in steady state)
Extreme muscle mass conditions (bodybuilders, amputees, malnutrition)
limitations: Less accurate when actual GFR >60 mL/min/1.73m²
Affected by non-creatinine chromogens and medications
Does not replace measured GFR when precise assessment needed
clinical_use.population: Adults ≥18 years with stable kidney function, validated in diverse populations but primarily developed in patients with CKD
